page.title: 06ST. INGUNGER FARM 2
page.content: 380 young stock (fresians for herd replacement) and Hereford cross fresians for beef) Approx. 1,000 gallons of milk per day is produced in the milking parlour which takes 16 cows a time. 2 men milk twice daily. The milk is cooled, stored in tanks and delivered to Lostwithiel creamery each morning. The cattle eat grass in summer and silage and hay in the winter. This is supplemented by special pellets which cost Â£140 per ton and approx 25 tons each month is needed. A computerised feeding system in the parlour,calculates how much each cow needs, according to her milk yield and how near to calving she is. Ideally each cow has one calf each year. These are hand-reared on special
